Posts.Content: Warning ! I had the exact same thing in the same spot. I procrastinated and one night after a bodacious supper it protrude through my stomach muscles (I've forgotten all the terminologies) and I ended up in the emergency room the next morning with pain like I've never experienced before or since. The doctor on call pushed it back through and I was at the surgeon's office the next day and had it repaired within 24 hours. If you could experience that pain for seconds....you would have already had it repaired. It was rough. edited to ad: I was about a year out from surgery
Posts.Title: Incisional Hernia - anyone experienced?

Posts.Content: Dr. Thomas Ahlering and a group of doctors in Cali just release the results of a large study that showed that T replacement for post-prostatectomy, low risk patients may actually lower BCR . Game changer in many ways if true.
